instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3476 different one no io board
threads.message:
Hi all, got in a MacBook 820-3476 this one does not reconize USB from the io board.

wifi works
hdmi works also


tested differnt cables and io board all the same

j9500 pin4 5.15v
pin3 3.344volt

threads.title: 820-3476 different one no io board
threads.message: Diode mode on pin 15 and 17 of J9510. Inspect those pins for damage too.

threads.title: 820-3476 different one no io board
threads.message:
pin17 0.404
pin15 0.398
pins look nice and shiny

threads.title: 820-3476 different one no io board
threads.message: Check if all 4 USB over current inputs are high EXTA_OC_L and EXTB,c,d

threads.title: 820-3476 different one no io board
threads.message:
XDP_USB_EXTA_OC_L 3.278v
XDP_USB_EXTB_OC_L 3.276v
XDP_USB_EXTC_OC_L 3.268v
XDP_USB_EXTD_OC_L 3.268v

had a short moment of usb mouse light, but only 1 time ....

threads.title: 820-3476 different one no io board
threads.message:
There is nothing more to this. Just 2 data lines, 5V and the over current protection. Could be a bad USB port on the PCH. You did check for stable 5V under load by plugging in a USB HDD to see if it spins up?

USB_5 seems to be free on the PCH, if the test points are accessible then you could wire them to the bad port.
